generation_task: A smart city platform manages different types of users (Operators, Analysts, and Engineers) who monitor and control traffic signals across the city. Each user can hold multiple roles, such as monitoring data and managing maintenance tasks. The system maintains a single shared traffic control instance to coordinate all signals and prevent inconsistent updates.

A company wants to build a music streaming platform that supports multiple platforms (Web, Mobile, Desktop). Each platform must have its own style of player, interface, and storage system. The app should be able to generate the correct set of related components depending on the platform being used.

A file management application needs to represent hierarchical data where both individual files and folders can be managed uniformly. Each folder can contain files or subfolders, and operations like calculating total size or displaying structure should be performed recursively across all elements.

A hospital system manages staff members who can have multiple responsibilities such as Doctor, Nurse, or Administrator. The system must support adding new staff roles dynamically while allowing the creation of different staff categories. The creation logic for staff members must be centralized, ensuring consistency in instantiation.

An online publishing platform manages articles that can be enhanced with additional features such as tagging, translation, and highlighting. The system should allow features to be added dynamically without modifying the core article class, supporting flexible combinations of features.
